II. Purpose of Addendum
St. Francis Family Services has applied for authorization to supervise Independent
Living Placements.
III. Methodology
08/05/2008- Received a Child Placing Agency Application to add authorization to
Supervise Independent Living to the agency programs.
09/18/2008- Onsite inspection. Reviewed agency’s policies and procedures for
Independent Living Services.
09/23/2008- Addendum to Original Licensing Study completed. Authorization for
Independent Living Services approved.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
St. Francis Family Services is an established Child Placing Agency. The agency has a
regular license and has a contract with the Department of Human Service (DHS) to
provide foster care services. The agency has been authorized to certify foster homes
for licensure; to receive children for placement in licensed foster homes; to evaluate
applicants for adoption; and to place and supervise children with adoptive parents. The
license is effective June 20, 2007-June 19, 2009.
On August 5, 2008, the agency applied to add authorization of Supervised Independent
Living Placements to their program. On September 18, 2008, the agency completed the
policies and procedures for Independent Living Services The policies and procedures
were reviewed and approved. The Chief Administrator states that DHS will fund the
Independent Living placements as part of a continuum of foster care services.
V. Recommendation
It is recommended that St. Francis Family Services be approved to provide
Independent Living Services.
